title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.2: ADOLESCENT EMPOWERMENT & GENDER

description.narrative: By 2024, Adolescents, especially the socially excluded in targeted locations, have greater opportunities to exercise their citizens' rights and demand accountability from decision makers., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children, especially the poorest, the most excluded and those affected by crisis, have access to child-sensitive and shock- responsive social services, benefit from positive community practices and are empowered to be agents of change within their communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, Adolescents, especially the socially excluded in targeted locations, have greater opportunities to exercise theircitizens? rights and demand accountability from decision makers.

description.narrative: In DRC, more than 150,000 adolescents interacted with local and urban children committees. Among them were child reporters and youth taking part in online discussions (UNICEF Facebook and Pona bana pages), making their voices heard by decision-makers. The new programmes of Bana Okapi, the children and youth radio;were launched. Bana Okapi now broadcasts programmes for DRC youth on a wide range of topics. A productive network of youth across DRC allowing more than 560,000 adolescents to participate in online and offline civic engagement initiatives to support the programme. This year, the country office appointed a national youth ambassador | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/12/2021
